Uses of Class
net.minecraftforge.client.event.ScreenEvent.MouseInputEvent

Packages that use ScreenEvent.MouseInputEvent
Package
Description
net.minecraftforge.client.event
Events fired only on the client-side, chiefly related to rendering and user interfaces (screens and input).

  • Uses of ScreenEvent.MouseInputEvent in net.minecraftforge.client.event

    Subclasses of ScreenEvent.MouseInputEvent in net.minecraftforge.client.event
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseClickedEvent
    Fired when a mouse button is clicked.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseClickedEvent.Post
    Fired after the mouse click is handled, if the corresponding ScreenEvent.MouseClickedEvent.Pre was not cancelled.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseClickedEvent.Pre
    Fired before the mouse click is handled by the screen.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseDragEvent
    Fired when the mouse was dragged while a button is being held down.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseDragEvent.Post
    Fired after the mouse drag is handled, if not handled by the screen and the corresponding ScreenEvent.MouseDragEvent.Pre is not cancelled.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseDragEvent.Pre
    Fired before the mouse drag is handled by the screen.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseReleasedEvent
    Fired when a mouse button is released.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseReleasedEvent.Post
    Fired after the mouse release is handled, if the corresponding ScreenEvent.MouseReleasedEvent.Pre was not cancelled.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseReleasedEvent.Pre
    Fired before the mouse release is handled by the screen.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseScrollEvent
    Fired when the mouse was dragged while a button is being held down.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseScrollEvent.Post
    Fired after the mouse scroll is handled, if not handled by the screen and the corresponding ScreenEvent.MouseScrollEvent.Pre is not cancelled.
    static class 
    ScreenEvent.MouseScrollEvent.Pre
    Fired before the mouse scroll is handled by the screen.
